name: ListOnCallEntries
description:
Retrieve on-call entries within a specified time range.

Use this tool to get on-call entries for users according to specified escalation policies and rules within a given timeframe. Useful for managing on-call schedules and understanding who is responsible during specific periods. Ensure you have the required OAuth permissions (`oncalls.read`) before calling this tool.

parameters.name: versioning_header
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API to use by setting the `Accept` header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: The Content-Type header specifies the media type of the request. Use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. Defaults to the account time zone if not specified.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of on-call entries to retrieve per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination for search results, defining where to begin in the result set.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: additional_details_to_include
parameters.description: Array specifying additional details to include: 'escalation_policies', 'users', 'schedules'.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: filter_by_user_ids
parameters.description: Filters the on-call entries to include only those for the specified user IDs.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified user IDs.

parameters.name: filter_by_escalation_policy_ids
parameters.description: Array of escalation policy IDs to filter on-call entries, showing results only for specified IDs.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified escalation policy IDs.

parameters.name: filter_by_schedule_ids
parameters.description: An array of schedule IDs to filter results. Include `null` to add permanent on-calls for direct user escalation targets.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified schedule IDs. If `null` is provided in the array, it includes permanent on-calls due to direct user escalation targets.

parameters.name: start_time_range
parameters.description: Specify the start time for the search range. Defaults to the current time. Valid entries are up to 90 days in the future.

value_schema.description: The start of the time range over which you want to search. If an on-call period overlaps with the range, it will be included in the result. Defaults to current time. On-call shifts are limited to 90 days in the future.

parameters.name: end_time_range
parameters.description: The end of the time range for searching on-call entries. Must be within 90 days of current time and cannot be before the start time. Defaults to current time if not specified.

value_schema.description: The end of the time range over which you want to search. If an on-call period overlaps with the range, it will be included in the result. Defaults to current time. On-call shifts are limited to 90 days in the future, and the `until` time cannot be before the `since` time.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set this to true to include the total number of on-call entries in pagination responses. This may increase response time.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: return_earliest_on_call
parameters.description: Set to true to filter and return only the earliest on-call for each escalation policy, level, and user.

value_schema.description: This will filter on-calls such that only the earliest on-call for each combination of escalation policy, escalation level, and user is returned. This is useful for determining when the "next" on-calls are for a given set of filters.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: user_ids[]
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified user IDs.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified user IDs.

parameters.name: escalation_policy_ids[]
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified escalation policy IDs.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified escalation policy IDs.

parameters.name: schedule_ids[]
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified schedule IDs. If `null` is provided in the array, it includes permanent on-calls due to direct user escalation targets.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified schedule IDs. If `null` is provided in the array, it includes permanent on-calls due to direct user escalation targets.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the time range over which you want to search. If an on-call period overlaps with the range, it will be included in the result. Defaults to current time. On-call shifts are limited to 90 days in the future.

value_schema.description: The start of the time range over which you want to search. If an on-call period overlaps with the range, it will be included in the result. Defaults to current time. On-call shifts are limited to 90 days in the future.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the time range over which you want to search. If an on-call period overlaps with the range, it will be included in the result. Defaults to current time. On-call shifts are limited to 90 days in the future, and the `until` time cannot be before the `since` time.

value_schema.description: The end of the time range over which you want to search. If an on-call period overlaps with the range, it will be included in the result. Defaults to current time. On-call shifts are limited to 90 days in the future, and the `until` time cannot be before the `since` time.

parameters.name: earliest
parameters.description: This will filter on-calls such that only the earliest on-call for each combination of escalation policy, escalation level, and user is returned. This is useful for determining when the "next" on-calls are for a given set of filters.

value_schema.description: This will filter on-calls such that only the earliest on-call for each combination of escalation policy, escalation level, and user is returned. This is useful for determining when the "next" on-calls are for a given set of filters.

parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.
